meanings.definition: Electricity generated from the energy of moving water.
meanings.sent1: Hydropower is used to produce electricity in many countries.
meanings.sent2: The hydropower plant harnesses the energy of rivers to generate electricity.
meanings.sent3: The hydropower station had a water fight to generate electricity - what a splash!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity flowed like hydropower, lighting up the room with ideas.
meanings.sent5: The force of hydropower cascaded down the waterfall, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The power derived from the energy of falling or flowing water.
meanings.sent1: The village relied on hydropower for its energy needs.
meanings.sent2: Hydropower is a renewable energy source that helps reduce carbon emissions.
meanings.sent3: The hydropower system danced with the rhythm of the flowing river.
meanings.sent4: His determination was a steady stream of hydropower, propelling him forward.
meanings.sent5: The potential of hydropower surged through the valley, bringing life to the region.
